Dialogue: Benjamin, when you came up here, what did you think was going to happen between us?

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: Elaine - right now I don't feel like talking much.  I'm sorry about everything but I think I'll just do this now.

Speaker: elaine
Dialogue: Can I just sit here while you're packing?

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: No.  I have two.  The other one is the one I'm looking for.  It's from my grandmother.

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: The belt I'm looking for was from my grandmother.

Speaker: elaine
Dialogue: What are you going to do now?

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: Elaine - you're going to have to stop asking me that.

Speaker: elaine
Dialogue: I don't want you to leave tomorrow.

Speaker: elaine
Dialogue: I don't want you to go anywhere until you have a definite plan.

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: Is that so?  You might marry me?

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: How about tomorrow?  I don't mean to be pushy but -

Speaker: elaine
Dialogue: I don't know.  I don't know what's happening.

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: Well - look - don't be confused. We're getting married.

Speaker: elaine
Dialogue: I don't see how we can.

Speaker: elaine
Dialogue: I have to go back now.

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: Elaine - are you serious about this?

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: We could go down and get our blood tests tomorrow.

Dialogue: Benjamin - I haven't even said I'll marry you yet.

Dialogue: We'll need our Birth Certificates. I happen to have mine with me. Where's yours?

Dialogue: I just don't think it would work.

Speaker: elaine
Dialogue: I just don't think it would...

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: Tomorrow then - can we get our blood tests tomorrow morning?

Speaker: elaine
Dialogue: Why don't you just drag me off if you want to marry me so much?

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: Why don't I just drag you off?  All right - I will. Right after we get the blood tests.

Speaker: elaine
Dialogue: Well - I have to see Carl first.

Speaker: elaine
Dialogue: Carl Smith.  He's a medical student.  We've known him for years.

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: Who - that guy at the Zoo?

Dialogue: Why do you have to see him?

Speaker: elaine
Dialogue: Well -- I said I might marry him.

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: How did he do it?  Did he get down on his knees?  He didn't get down on his knees, I hope.

Dialogue: Well, what did he say?  I'm curious.

Speaker: elaine
Dialogue: He said he thought we'd make a pretty good team.

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: I'd like to know where it happened?

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: It wasn't in his car, was it?

Speaker: elaine
Dialogue: Maybe we are and maybe we aren't.

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: It was nothing to do with you, sir.

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: I am trying to tell you I have no personal feelings about you, Mr. Robinson.  I am trying to tell you I do not resent you.

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: It shouldn't make any difference what happened.

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: Listen to me.  We got - we got into bed with each other.  But it was nothing.  It was nothing at all.  We might - we might just as well have been shaking hands.

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: The point is - I don't love your wife.  I love your daughter, sir.

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: Mr. McCleery - do you have some change?  I need to use the phone?

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: Look - I'll give you ten dollars for a dime - I'll give you twenty - for God's sake, will you let me use that phone?

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: Could I make one phone call first?

My father is so upset you've got to understand.  I love you, but it would never work out.

Dialogue: What have you done to her?

Dialogue: You can't stop me from seeing her, Mrs. Robinson.  I'll find her.
